lead_paragraph: A bill that could fine distracted drivers as much as $800 has led to an outcry among residents for whom driving is more a state of being than an activity.

headline.print_headline: Lashing Out in New Jersey Over Limits for Drivers
headline.main: A Distracted-Driving Ban in New Jersey? Some Say It Threatens a Way of Life

snippet: A bill that could fine distracted drivers as much as $800 has led to an outcry among residents for whom driving is more a state of being than an activity....
abstract: New Jersey drivers lash out after State Assemblyman John Wisniewski re-introduces bill that would, if passed, impose fines of up to $800 on drivers caught engaging in distracting behavior; critics say existing laws are more than sufficient, and worry that some police officers will take advantage of bill’s vague language and abuse their powers.
